title: Finding the Fountain of Youth—Introduction to the Modern Biology of Aging
description: This class will provide an overview of current understanding of the biology of aging and potential interventional strategies to promote longevity. Designed for biology majors who want to better understand the exciting research of aging in recent years, the course will cover basic but important questions about aging: what is known about how and why people age, how to study the biology of aging, why are older people more likely to experience some diseases, and slowing or reversing the aging process. Prerequisites: BILD 1.
